name: Sea Shore Motel

reviews.text: This hotel was rated high on trip advisor so we thought we'd try it out. The room was ok. Very noisy room, the resturant across the street had loud music playing but not til very late. Room was clean. The location was great we walked everywhere. The front desk guys were very helpful and friendly.The value was good for Santa Monica but I think if we come back we will try another hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, noisy room

reviews.text: We chose this motel on the basis of good reviews here. It was not a disappointment, on the contrary! We had some practical inquiries concerning shopping, offices, car services etc., and the people at the reception were both very eager and very knowledgeable to help us out. Amazingly friendly!
reviews.title: Fantastic service and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Moreover the room was very clean, and the location is great.
reviews.title: A Very Nice Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in October. We arrived early and we were given a room without a problem. This is a great location - an easy two blocks to the beach, coffee shop next door with great food, an Italian restaurant across the street, breakfast spot down the street, pizza close by... anyway lots of places to eat. On Sunday mornings there is a farmers market directly across the street with more great food! It is about 20 minutes to LAX and just a couple of blocks to the interstate. We walked to the beach, down to Venice, up to the Santa Monica Pier, the Third Street Promenade - all easy walking.
reviews.title: Liked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was pretty basic and more than adequate, we were not on vacation to be in our room. Two beds, mini fridge for refreshments, and a good shower. The desk staff at the hotel are very helpful and they are the main reason we will return, combined with the location and price this is a great spot. There was some noise on Friday night from the street, perhaps next time I will ask for a room near the back. I would not hesitate to return.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights recently. The location is superb and the staff are very friendly and helpful, especially Ken who was always willing to help out. However it is a bit noisy at night so bring your ear plugs. The property itself is a bit dated and could use a freshen up, but its clean and serves its purpose.
reviews.title: Good location, bit noisy though.

reviews.text: Good rate and clean place in this area. Nothing fancy, but good for a one night stop in Santa Monica. Staff where very helpful and accomodating.
reviews.title: Good Location Inexpensive Room

reviews.text: This hotel was clean,the room was a little noisy from the traffic on the street and they were doing sme type of construction around the back which was also a little bit noisy.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great and not enough people mention that Main street has a lot of nice shops with art work or products made by locals.You can walk to Venice Beach in about 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Great place!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free parking is great. Dont forget the late night meters if you are driving around in the area.
reviews.title: Homely and friendly motel in great location

reviews.text: Our family of five (Dad, Mum and children x 3) stayed at the Sea Shore for one night only.
reviews.title: Great service, price & location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wished we had time to stay an extra night.
reviews.title: Just a stone throw from the beach

reviews.text: Excellent location only a block from the beach and on the same street as numerous resturants/pubs & shops.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great service, clean and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tom was very good with explaining where and what to do around Santa Monica.
reviews.title: Great place and location

reviews.text: The family suite was on the 1st Floor (2nd floor in American terms) and had a large bedroom with 2 queen size beds, Main room had a queen pull-out which was very comfortable for a pull-out. also had a good size Kitchen which we didnt really use.
reviews.title: Fantastic, affordable and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our fourth stay at the Sea shore and that alone speaks to the fact that the Sea shore is a good place to stay. The motel itself is a basic motel but it is clean and has all the amenities you'd need (aircon, cable TV a comfy bed etc).. Each time I've stayed, I've found the staff to be incredibly accomodating.
reviews.title: Prime location, great spot

reviews.text: Where the seashore really shines however is its location on Santa Monica's main street where there is no sortage of good eats (Lula the mexican restaurant is a standout, as is the pizza place whose name I can never remember, and Groundworks also do a surprisingly decent coffee)... Nicer still the beach is only a short stroll away and the farmers market happens every sunday directly across the road.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: LA can be a pretty ugly and grim place but there are pockets of sublime beauty there and Santa Monica is definitely one of them. I'm definitely going back again and I'll be staying at the Seashore again too
reviews.title: Great motel, great location, warm friendly service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our party of four adults stayed here for the last 3 nights of our 2-week holiday in Los Angeles. We chose it because of the mainly good reviews on TA, because of its very reasonable price when compared with other holiday accomodations in Santa Monica, and because of its excellent location. We weren't disappointed.
reviews.title: Overpriced, old fashioned rooms and average location

reviews.text: Check in went smoothly - Tom was pleasant & laid-back (and was also very helpful when we needed to book a taxi to Hollywood). We had 2 adjacent rooms on the ground floor, each with a king-size bed. Each of the rooms was clean & roomy with a fridge & ample cupboard space. We didn't have a car, but my son, who lives in LA, came to visit and was able to park his car in the motel's good-sized car park. Chris & Sonya (two of the joint owners of this family-run motel) were also very friendly and we were allowed to do our online check-in for our return flight on the computer in the reception area.
reviews.title: great place,fantastic location

description: Our rooms feature terra-cotta tile floors, refrigerators, air conditioning, cable TV, granite counter tops and more. We have a sun deck and an on-site restaurant and Laundromat. All our rooms are non-smoking. We offer free parking in our own parking lot. We are located within walking distance to all Santa Monica attractions and within a 1/2 hour drive to all Los Angeles attractions. Plus, we're only TWO SHORT BLOCKS from Santa Monica's famous white sand beach. Along historic and charming Main Street are numerous restaurants, art galleries, museums, dress shops, coffee shops, and more. A 2 night minimum stay is required on weekends and holidays.
